citations.narrative:
An adult female Mini Australian Shepherd (microchip number 1657) escaped from the facility on 01-September-2022. The
facility representative was unsure how the dog escaped the enclosure. However, the disposition records (APHIS 7005
form) noted the date of the incident and that the dog had jumped out of pen and ran away. The outside runs of the primary
enclosure has fencing that is approximately 34 3/4 inches tall and have open tops. The dog that escaped was not
recovered by the facility. Primary enclosures that do not safely contain the animals can lead to animal escape that can
expose the animals to injury or death. The licensee must ensure that all primary enclosures are constructed so that they
contain the animals securely. Correct by 12-April-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(iii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
An adult female Mini Australian Shepherd (microchip number 1657) escaped from the facility on 01-September-2022. The 
facility representative was unsure how the dog escaped the enclosure. However, the disposition records (APHIS 7005 
form) noted the date of the incident and that the dog had jumped out of pen and ran away. The outside runs of the primary 
enclosure has fencing that is approximately 34 3/4 inches tall and have open tops. The dog that escaped was not 
recovered by the facility. Primary enclosures that do not safely contain the animals can lead to animal escape that can 
expose the animals to injury or death. The licensee must ensure that all primary enclosures are constructed so that they 
contain the animals securely. Correct by 12-April-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
